Article.ArticleTitle: Degradation and Deactivation of Bacterial Antibiotic Resistance Genes during Exposure to Free Chlorine, Monochloramine, Chlorine Dioxide, Ozone, Ultraviolet Light, and Hydroxyl Radical.

AbstractText: This work investigated degradation (measured by qPCR) and biological deactivation (measured by culture-based natural transformation) of extra- and intracellular antibiotic resistance genes (eARGs and iARGs) by free available chlorine (FAC), NH<sub>2</sub>Cl, O<sub>3</sub>, ClO<sub>2</sub>, and UV light (254 nm), and of eARGs by <sup>•</sup>OH, using a chromosomal ARG ( blt) of multidrug-resistant Bacillus subtilis 1A189. Rate constants for degradation of four 266-1017 bp amplicons adjacent to or encompassing the acfA mutation enabling blt overexpression increased in proportion to #AT+GC bps/amplicon, or in proportion to #5'-GG-3' or 5'-TT-3' doublets/amplicon, with respective values ranging from 0.59 to 2.3 (×10<sup>11</sup> M<sup>-1</sup> s<sup>-1</sup>) for <sup>•</sup>OH, 1.8-6.9 (×10<sup>4</sup> M<sup>-1</sup> s<sup>-1</sup>) for O<sub>3</sub>, 3.9-9.2 (×10<sup>3</sup> M<sup>-1</sup> s<sup>-1</sup>) for FAC, 0.35-1.2(×10<sup>1</sup> M<sup>-1</sup> s<sup>-1</sup>) for ClO<sub>2</sub>, and 2.0-8.8 (×10<sup>-2</sup> cm<sup>2</sup>/mJ) for UV at pH 7, and from 1.7-4.4 M<sup>-1</sup> s<sup>-1</sup> for NH<sub>2</sub>Cl at pH 8. For FAC, NH<sub>2</sub>Cl, O<sub>3</sub>, ClO<sub>2</sub>, and UV, ARG deactivation paralleled degradation of amplicons approximating a ∼800-1000 bp acfA-flanking sequence required for natural transformation in B. subtilis, whereas deactivation outpaced degradation for <sup>•</sup>OH. At practical disinfectant exposures, eARGs and iARGs were ≥90% degraded/deactivated by FAC, O<sub>3</sub>, and UV, but recalcitrant to NH<sub>2</sub>Cl and ClO<sub>2</sub>. iARG degradation/ deactivation always lagged cell inactivation. These findings provide a quantitative framework for evaluating ARG fate during disinfection/oxidation, and support using qPCR as a proxy for tracking ARG deactivation under carefully selected circumstances.
